query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Se mai continga che ’l poema sacro 2 al quale ha posto mano e cielo e terra, 3 sì che m’ha fatto per molti anni macro,
query.error: **English:** 1 If ever it happens that the sacred poem 2 to which both heaven and earth have set their hand, 3 so that it has made me lean for many years,
query.result: 1 Gif hit geweorðeð ðæt ðæt halige poema 2 ðæm ðe heofon and eorðe hand on legdon, 3 swa ðæt hit me geworhte manega gear mægre,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 vinca la crudeltà che fuor mi serra 5 del bello ovile ov’ io dormi’ agnello, 6 nimico ai lupi che li danno guerra;
query.error: **English:** 4 overcomes the cruelty that shuts me out 5 from the fair fold where I slept as a lamb, 6 an enemy to the wolves that make war on it;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 con altra voce omai, con altro vello 8 ritornerò poeta, e in sul fonte 9 del mio battesmo prenderò ’l cappello;
query.error: **English:** 7 with another voice now, with another fleece, 8 I shall return a poet, and at the font 9 of my baptism I shall take the laurel wreath;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 però che ne la fede, che fa conte 11 l’anime a Dio, quivi intra’ io, e poi 12 Pietro per lei sì mi girò la fronte.
query.error: **English:** 10 because it was in the faith that makes souls known 11 to God that I entered there, and then 12 Peter for its sake so turned my brow.
query.result: 10 forðæm ðe on ðæm geleafan, se ðe cyðeð 11 ða sawla Gode, ðær ic in eode, and siððan 12 Petrus for ðæm swa me gewende ðone neb.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Indi si mosse un lume verso noi 14 di quella spera ond’ uscì la primizia 15 che lasciò Cristo d’i vicari suoi;
query.error: **English:** 13 Then a light moved towards us 14 from that sphere from which came the firstfruits 15 that Christ left of his vicars;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 e la mia donna, piena di letizia, 17 mi disse: «Mira, mira: ecco il barone 18 per cui là giù si vicita Galizia».
query.error: **English:** 16 and my lady, full of joy, 17 said to me: "Look, look: here is the baron 18 for whom Galicia is visited down there".
query.result: 16 and min lafdi, ful of blisse, 17 sæde to me: "Loca, loca: her is se barun 18 for hwan ðær niðer is Galicia isewen".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Sì come quando il colombo si pone 20 presso al compagno, l’uno a l’altro pande, 21 girando e mormorando, l’affezione;
query.error: **English:** 19 Just as when the dove alights 20 beside its mate, the one to the other shows, 21 turning and murmuring, its affection;
query.result: 19 Swa swa ðonne culufre bið geðrungen 20 neaðe be ðearfe ðæt heo hire macað 21 cyrreð and clyppeð and hire cneo ræðeð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 così vid’ ïo l’un da l’altro grande 23 principe glorïoso essere accolto, 24 laudando il cibo che là sù li prande.
query.error: **English:** 22 so I saw one great 23 glorious prince being welcomed by the other, 24 praising the food that nourishes them up there.
query.result: 22 ðus ic ða geseah ða mæran þeodnas 23 in ðam wuldre wlitig and wynsum 24 hergan and lofian ðone heofonlican mete.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Ma poi che ’l gratular si fu assolto, 26 tacito coram me ciascun s’affisse, 27 ignito sì che vincëa ’l mio volto.
query.error: **English:** 25 But after the greeting was finished, 26 each one stood silently before me, 27 glowing so that it conquered my face.
query.result: 25 Ac siððan ðæt gretan wæs geendod, 26 ða wæs æghwylc ðær ðurh ða gesihoe 27 byrnende swiðe ðæt hit min andwlita oferwann.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Ridendo allora Bëatrice disse: 29 «Inclita vita per cui la larghezza 30 de la nostra basilica si scrisse,
query.error: **English:** 28 Then Beatrice, smiling, said: 29 "Illustrious life for whom the generosity 30 of our basilica was written,
query.result: 28 ða ða Bēatrice ða ðus sprecende wæs, 29 "Wuldres lif ðurh ðone ðin willa wide 30 ðære cyrcan ðe ðu geworhtest,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 fa risonar la spene in questa altezza: 32 tu sai, che tante fiate la figuri, 33 quante Iesù ai tre fé più carezza».
query.error: **English:** 31 make hope resound in this height: 32 you know that as many times as you portray it, 33 so many times Jesus shows you more affection."
query.result: 31 ðu ða hyht ðurh ðas heahnysse hlyme: 32 ðu wast ðæt swa oft swa ðu ða gesetst, 33 swa oft ðe ðe selfa Hælend lufode."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 «Leva la testa e fa che t’assicuri: 35 che ciò che vien qua sù del mortal mondo, 36 convien ch’ai nostri raggi si maturi».
query.error: **English:** 34 "Lift up your head and be assured, 35 for that which comes up here from the mortal world 36 must ripen in our rays."
query.result: 34 "Hefe ðin heafod and beo ðu getrymmed: 35 ðæt ðe of ðissum deadlicum life cymð, 36 ðæt sceal on urum leohte geweorðan."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Questo conforto del foco secondo 38 mi venne; ond’ io leväi li occhi a’ monti 39 che li ’ncurvaron pria col troppo pondo.
query.error: **English:** 37 This comfort of the second fire 38 came to me; then I raised my eyes to the mountains 39 that had bowed them down before with their excessive weight.
query.result: 37 Þes frófre of ðæm óðrum fyre 38 me becóm; ðá ic upp áhóf míne eágan tó ðæm muntum 39 ðe ær míne hrycg gebíged hæfdon mid heora miclan byrðene.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 sì che, veduto il ver di questa corte, 44 la spene, che là giù bene innamora, 45 in te e in altrui di ciò conforte,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 di’ quel ch’ell’ è, di’ come se ne ’nfiora 47 la mente tua, e dì onde a te venne». 48 Così seguì ’l secondo lume ancora.

query.result: 46 sege hwet hit sy, sege hu ðin mod ðurh hit 47 gewlitegod is, and sege hwanon hit ðe becwom." 48 Þus ic folgode ðæm oðrum leohte eft.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 E quella pïa che guidò le penne 50 de le mie ali a così alto volo, 51 a la risposta così mi prevenne:
query.error: **English:** 49 And that most pious one who guided the feathers 50 of my wings to such a high flight, 51 anticipated me in the response thus:
query.result: 49 And seo mildheortlice ðe lædde ða fjeðru 50 minra wædra to ðæs hean fleoge, 51 me ðus forecwæð to ðære andsware:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 52 "Þeos circe militesc næfð nænne sunu 53 mid maran hyhte, swa swa hit is awriten 54 on ðære Sunnan ðe scineð ofer eall ure werod:

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

61 a lui lasc’ io, ché non li saran forti 62 né di iattanza; ed elli a ciò risponda, 63 e la grazia di Dio ciò li comporti».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 «Spene», diss’ io, «è uno attender certo 68 de la gloria futura, il qual produce 69 grazia divina e precedente merto.
query.error: **English:** 67 "Hope," I said, "is a certain expectation 68 of future glory, which produces 69 divine grace and preceding merit.
query.result: 67 "Hyht," cwæð ic, "is georn and gewisse wen 68 toweardes ðære æfterran wuldre, ðe gewirco 69 Godes gife and ðæs ðe man ær wel gedihð."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Da molte stelle mi vien questa luce; 71 ma quei la distillò nel mio cor pria 72 che fu sommo cantor del sommo duce.
query.error: **English:** 70 From many stars this light comes to me; 71 but he distilled it into my heart before 72 he was the supreme singer of the supreme leader.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 ‘Sperino in te’, ne la sua tëodia 74 dice, ‘color che sanno il nome tuo’: 75 e chi nol sa, s’elli ha la fede mia?
query.error: **English:** 73 ‘I hope in you’, in his theology 74 he says, ‘those who know your name’: 75 and who does not know it, if he has my faith?
query.result: 73 ‘Ic hyhte on ðe’, on hisre lare 74 cwæð, ‘ða þe ðinne naman cunnon’: 75 and hwa ne cann hine, gif he hæfð minne geleafan?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Tu mi stillasti, con lo stillar suo, 77 ne la pistola poi; sì ch’io son pieno, 78 e in altrui vostra pioggia repluo».

query.result: 76 ðu me styredest, ðurh his styrunge, 77 on ðam pistole siððan; swa ðæt ic eom full, 78 and on oðrum ðinne renas ic geote’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 79 Þa ic ðæt sæde, on ðæs fyres bosme 80 lyt swigode, ðær ða leoman stod, 81 hwilum ðuniende, hwilum ðuniende.

85 vuol ch’io respiri a te che ti dilette 86 di lei; ed emmi a grato che tu diche 87 quello che la speranza ti ’mpromette».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 E io: «Le nove e le scritture antiche 89 pongon lo segno, ed esso lo mi addita, 90 de l’anime che Dio s’ha fatte amiche.
query.error: **English:** 88 And I: "The new and the old scriptures 89 set the sign, and it points out to me 90 the souls that God has made his friends."
query.result: 88 And ic: "Þa niwan and þa ealdan gewritu 89 settað þone tacn, and hit me tæcð, 90 ðara sawla þe God him hæfð to freondum geworhte."

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

94 e ’l tuo fratello assai vie più digesta, 95 là dove tratta de le bianche stole, 96 questa revelazion ci manifesta».

query.result: 94 and ðin broðor ðæt gemacað swiðe gesæligra, 95 ðær he secgð be ðam hwitan gyrlum, 96 ðeos gesyhð ðæt us tæcð».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 E prima, appresso al fin d’este parole, 98 ‘Sperent in te’ di sopr’ a noi s’udì; 99 a che rispuoser tutte le carole.
query.error: **English:** 97 And first, after the end of these words, 98 “Hope in thee” was heard above us; 99 to which all the choirs responded.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Poscia tra esse un lume si schiarì 101 sì che, se ’l Cancro avesse un tal cristallo, 102 l’inverno avrebbe un mese d’un sol dì.
query.error: **English:** 100 Then among them a light became so bright 101 that if Cancer had such a crystal, 102 winter would have a month of only one day.
query.result: 100 Þa betwux him leoht ongon scinan 101 swa ðæt, gif Cancer hæfde swylcne gim, 102 winter hæfde anne monað anes dæges.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 E come surge e va ed entra in ballo 104 vergine lieta, sol per fare onore 105 a la novizia, non per alcun fallo,

query.result: 103 And swa swa mægð, ðe ðæs myrige is 104 ðære bryde to wurðmynte an, 105 ðurh nænne gylt, ac ðurh ðone goman,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 così vid’ io lo schiarato splendore 107 venire a’ due che si volgieno a nota 108 qual conveniesi al loro ardente amore.
query.error: **English:** 106 so I saw the radiant splendor 107 come to the two who were turning in time 108 with the measure that befits their ardent love.
query.result: 106 ðus ðone sciman geseah ic ðær cuma 107 to ðam twam ðe ðær wendan him 108 swa swa heora lufe gelimpð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Misesi lì nel canto e ne la rota; 110 e la mia donna in lor tenea l’aspetto, 111 pur come sposa tacita e immota.
query.error: **English:** 109 He placed himself there in the corner and on the wheel; 110 and my lady kept her gaze on them, 111 just like a silent and motionless bride.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 «Questi è colui che giacque sopra ’l petto 113 del nostro pellicano, e questi fue 114 di su la croce al grande officio eletto».
query.error: **English:** 112 "This is he who lay upon the breast 113 of our pelican, and this is he who was 114 chosen on the cross for the great office."
query.result: 112 "Þes is se ðe læg on ðæs infodes breoste 113 ures peliicanes, and ðes wæs se ðe wæs 114 on ðære rode to ðam micclan ambehte gecoren."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 La donna mia così; né però piùe 116 mosser la vista sua di stare attenta 117 poscia che prima le parole sue.
query.error: **English:** 115 My lady spoke thus; nor did she move 116 her gaze from being attentive 117 after her first words.
query.result: 115 Þus cwæð min laf; ne heo ðeah ðæs mare 116 hire gesihðe awende of ðære wæccan 117 siððan hire ærest word gecwæð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Qual è colui ch’adocchia e s’argomenta 119 di vedere eclissar lo sole un poco, 120 che, per veder, non vedente diventa;
query.error: **English:** 118 Like someone who strains his eyes and tries 119 to see a solar eclipse a little, 120 and, by looking, becomes blind;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 tal mi fec’ ïo a quell’ ultimo foco 122 mentre che detto fu: «Perché t’abbagli 123 per veder cosa che qui non ha loco?
query.error: **English:** 121 so I became when I looked at that final fire, 122 while it was said to me: "Why do you blind yourself 123 trying to see something that has no place here?
query.result: 121 Swa ic ða ðone æfterestan fyr 122 ða ða ðæt word cwæð: "Hwi ðu ðe ablendast 123 ðurh ðæt ðu ðæt ðing geseon woldest

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 In terra è terra il mio corpo, e saragli 125 tanto con li altri, che ’l numero nostro 126 con l’etterno proposito s’agguagli.
query.error: **English:** 124 My body is earth on earth, and it will be there 125 with the others, until our number 126 is equal to the eternal plan.
query.result: 124 ðe her næfre ne bið? 125 On eorðan is min lichama, and he ðær wunað 126 mid ðam oðrum, oð ðæt ure rím

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Con le due stole nel beato chiostro 128 son le due luci sole che saliro; 129 e questo apporterai nel mondo vostro».
query.error: **English:** 127 With the two garlands in the blessed cloister 128 are the two only lights that ascended; 129 and this you will carry back to your world."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 A questa voce l’infiammato giro 131 si quïetò con esso il dolce mischio 132 che si facea nel suon del trino spiro,
query.error: **English:** 130 At this voice the flaming circle 131 became quiet, along with the sweet mingling 132 that was made in the sound of the threefold breath,
query.result: 130 Æt ðære stefne se liggende hring 131 gestilde mid ðam swetan gesomne 132 ðe geworht wæs on ðam swege ðæs ðreofealdan gæstes,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 sì come, per cessar fatica o rischio, 134 li remi, pria ne l’acqua ripercossi, 135 tutti si posano al sonar d’un fischio.
query.error: **English:** 133 just as, to cease toil or danger, 134 the oars, previously striking the water, 135 all come to rest at the sound of a whistle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 presso di lei, e nel mondo felice!
query.error: **English:** 139 near her, and in the happy world!
query.result: 139 hire gehende, and on ðam gesæligan worulde!
